text: data integrity is at the top of mind for
people today and has a far-reaching
impact across a broad range of
businesses and industries from banks
that need to maintain a history of
credit and debit transactions to
manufacturers that need to track where
parts were sourced and more but
record-keeping has its challenges you
can implement this today with
traditional databases using audit logs
but that is hard to scale error-prone
and not immutable so there is no way to
know for sure if data has been
overwritten or deleted alternatively you
could use blockchain frameworks because
of their built in immutable ledger
however blockchain frameworks are ideal
when multiple parties are looking to
work with one another in a decentralized
way so they can end up adding
unnecessary complexity and cost to build
out that's all changing now introducing
Amazon QLD be a purpose-built ledger
database that provides a complete and
accurate way to keep records with an
immutable and verifiable history of all
application data changes now with Amazon
ql DB you can have a fully managed
ledger database owned by a central
trusted Authority it delivers four key
benefits 1ql DB is immutable and
transparent tracking and maintaining a
sequence record of each and every change
to your data which is permanently stored
and can't be deleted or modified to data
is cryptographically verifiable ql DB
leverage is the same underlying
technology as blockchain frameworks
using a sha-256 hash function to
generate a secure output file so you can
fully trust and verify the integrity of
your data 3 it's easy to use it has a
flexible document data model which lets
you easily operate on your data using a
sequel like query language known as
particle plus QL DB transactions are
acid compliant and have full
serializability the highest level of
isolation for ql DB is serverless
it automatically scales with your
application and you don't need to worry
about provisioning capacity
and since its centralized it doesn't
require multiple parties to agree to one
another before committing transactions
to the ledger so it's much faster than
blockchains ql DB can be applied
anywhere there is a need for system of
record type applications so whatever
business you're in you can accurately
maintain data while creating a permanent
historical record that is of everlasting
value get started with ql DB today
